                                                   .. container::

                                                      .. rubric:: CAN
                                                         Protocol in
                                                         STM32 Part-II
                                                         :name: de18

                                                      .. container::

                                                         .. container::

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981>`__

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                                    |Harshdixit|

                                                                                    .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                                    .. container::

                                                                                       .. container::

                                                                                          .. container::

                                                                                             `Harshdixit <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981>`__

                                                                                 ·

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                                    `Follow <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/can-protocol-in-stm32-part-ii-59c9fb75b6e2>`__

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                              3
                                                                              min
                                                                              read

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 ·

                                                                              Jun
                                                                              11

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                                    ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/can-protocol-in-stm32-part-ii-59c9fb75b6e2>`__

                                                                                    .. container::

                                                                                       .. container::

                                                                                          .. container::

                                                                                             .. container::

                                                                                                Listen

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                                    Share

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 514a

                                                      In Previous part
                                                      we have seen the
                                                      brief about CAN
                                                      protocol how it
                                                      get used and how
                                                      it get implemented
                                                      in the CAN
                                                      peripheral and
                                                      There CAN Tx and
                                                      CAN Rx .

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 5181

                                                      We had seen that
                                                      there are CAN
                                                      Identifier
                                                      RTR(Remote
                                                      Transmission
                                                      Request) IDE
                                                      (Identifier ) for
                                                      Standard ID or
                                                      Extended ID

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 35ef

                                                      And Other part
                                                      such as DLC (Data
                                                      length) DataField
                                                      CheckSum DEL CRC
                                                      ACK DEL is the
                                                      Acknowledgement
                                                      part then EOF( End
                                                      Of File)
                                                      ITM(Interrupt
                                                      manipulation) Bus
                                                      Idle (Bus Matrix)

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 0d3c

                                                      . Here the **BAUD
                                                      RATE** is set to
                                                      500000bps. You can
                                                      try different
                                                      combinations for
                                                      **Prescalar and
                                                      Time Quanta** to
                                                      achieve this.

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: fae9

                                                      . The Operating
                                                      Mode is **NORMAL
                                                      Mode.**

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 5f08

                                                      . Pins are PA11
                                                      and PA12 are set
                                                      as **CAN_RX** and
                                                      **CAN_TX**

                                                   .. figure:: .//f2256d1836cefdeff74e991def20ae06f820e937.webp
                                                      :alt: Circuitry
                                                      Connection for CAN
                                                      :width: 672px
                                                      :height: 440px

                                                      Circuitry
                                                      Connection for CAN

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: c2dc

                                                      Also there is
                                                      **120 ohms
                                                      Resistance** at
                                                      each node. This is
                                                      very important, or
                                                      else you will not
                                                      get the data.

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: c0bf

                                                      in main.c USER
                                                      BEGIN 0

                                                   ::



                                                      CAN_TxHeaderTypeDef TxHeader; // TxHeader Store information like RTR,DLC,etc.
                                                      uint8_t TxData[8]; // To store the data, that we are going to transmit over the CAN bus
                                                      uint32_t TxMailbox; // TxMailbox will sent to the CAN bus. 

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 9a86

                                                      Now we will store
                                                      the required
                                                      values in the
                                                      TxHeader and in
                                                      the TxData.

                                                   ::

                                                      TxHeader.IDE = CAN_ID_STD; // setting ID to Standard ID 
                                                      TxHeader.StdId = 0x446; // Identifier
                                                      TxHeader.RTR = CAN_RTR_DATA;// Setting Remote Transmission Request 
                                                      TxHeader.DLC =2;//Data Length of Data bytes 

                                                      TxData[0] = 50; 
                                                      TxData[1] = 0xAA; 

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: f614

                                                      Now we have the
                                                      information ready
                                                      to be transmitted
                                                      now we will
                                                      finally transmit
                                                      it on the CAN bus.

                                                   ::

                                                      if( HAL_CAN_AddTxMessage(&hcan1, &TxHeader, TxData,&TxMailbox) != HAL_OK)
                                                                 Error_handle();

                                                   .. figure:: .//fa5b722e93e579344e3ba73e1e08f8781e06fd20.webp
                                                      :alt: As you can
                                                      see the data here
                                                      :width: 700px
                                                      :height: 85px

                                                      As you can see the
                                                      data here

                                                   .. rubric:: **Filter
                                                      Configuration**
                                                      :name: 1250

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 0c5c

                                                      In Order to reduce
                                                      the CPU Load to
                                                      filter out
                                                      messages , the
                                                      STM32 have the
                                                      filters built
                                                      inside the CAN
                                                      peripheral.

                                                   ::

                                                      CAN_FilterTypeDef canfilterconfig;

                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterActivation = CAN_FILTER_ENABLE;//we want to enable filter or not
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterBank = 18; // filter bank 20 in single can peri you can choose 0 to 13
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterFIFOAssignment = CAN_FILTER_FIFO0;// FIFO0 and FIFO1 so choosing it 
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterIdHigh = 0x446 << 5 ;// Register for 16 bits it compare to incoming identifier 
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterIdLow =0 ; // Register for 8 bit compare to identifier 
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterMaskIdHigh = 0x446 << 5;  // Masking the identifier it enable the comparison
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterMaskIdLow = 0x0000; // Masking the filter ID low 
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterMode = CAN_FILTERMODE_IDMASK; //MASK MODE in Filter in STM32 
                                                      canfilterconfig.FilterScale = CAN_FILTERSCALE_32BIT;
                                                      canfilterconfig.SlaveStartFilterBank = 20; // dual CAN peripheral have 28 Filter Banks

                                                      HAL_CAN_ConfigFilter(&hscan1, &canfilterconfig);

                                                   .. rubric:: RECEIVING
                                                      DATA
                                                      :name: 2330

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 1933

                                                      For recieving the
                                                      data in STM32

                                                   ::

                                                        if (HAL_CAN_ActivateNotification(&hcan1, CAN_IT_RX_FIFO0_MSG_PENDING) != HAL_OK)
                                                        {
                                                         Error_Handler();
                                                        }

                                                   ::

                                                      CAN_RxHeaderTypeDef   RxHeader;

                                                      uint8_t               RxData[8];

                                                      void HAL_CAN_RxFifo0MsgPendingCallback(CAN_HandleTypeDef *hcan)
                                                      {
                                                        if (HAL_CAN_GetRxMessage(hcan, CAN_RX_FIFO0, &RxHeader, RxData) != HAL_OK)
                                                        {
                                                          Error_Handler();
                                                        }

                                                        if ((RxHeader.StdId == 0x103))
                                                        {
                                                         datacheck = 1;
                                                        }

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: cdd8

                                                      you can use like
                                                      this also and you
                                                      can compare it to
                                                      the Identifier of
                                                      the RxHeader

                                                   .. container::
                                                      :name: 06ef

                                                      if it is true you
                                                      can turn on GPIO’s
                                                      pin

                                                   ::

                                                      if (datacheck) { HAL_GPIO_WritePin(GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_5, GPIO_PIN_SET); } // checking datacheck

                              .. container::

                                 .. container::

                           .. container::

                                                            .. container::

                                                               ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/can-protocol-in-stm32-97bac5a6f521>`__

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: CAN
                                                                     Protocol
                                                                     in
                                                                     STM32
                                                                     :name: can-protocol-in-stm32

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: CAN(
                                                                     Controlled
                                                                     Area
                                                                     Network
                                                                     )
                                                                     Protocol
                                                                     is
                                                                     a
                                                                     way
                                                                     of
                                                                     communication
                                                                     between
                                                                     different
                                                                     devices,
                                                                     but
                                                                     under
                                                                     certain
                                                                     rules.
                                                                     These
                                                                     rules
                                                                     must
                                                                     be…
                                                                     :name: can-controlled-area-network-protocol-is-a-way-of-communication-between-different-devices-but-under-certain-rules.-these-rules-must-be

                                                            ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/can-protocol-in-stm32-97bac5a6f521>`__

                                                            .. container::

                                                               5 min
                                                               read·Jun
                                                               9

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/can-protocol-in-stm32-97bac5a6f521>`__

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                       .. container::

                                          .. container::

                                             .. container::

                                                .. container::

                                                   .. container::

                                                      .. container::

                                                         .. container::

                                                            ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/difference-between-reg-and-wire-in-verilog-b7484610c849>`__

                                                            .. container::

                                                               |Difference
                                                               Between
                                                               Reg And
                                                               Wire In
                                                               Verilog|

                                                         .. container::

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981>`__

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           |Harshdixit|

                                                                           .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981>`__

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           Harshdixit

                                                            .. container::

                                                               ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/difference-between-reg-and-wire-in-verilog-b7484610c849>`__

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: Difference
                                                                     Between
                                                                     Reg
                                                                     And
                                                                     Wire
                                                                     In
                                                                     Verilog
                                                                     :name: difference-between-reg-and-wire-in-verilog

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: “Wire”
                                                                     elements
                                                                     must
                                                                     be
                                                                     continuously
                                                                     driven
                                                                     by
                                                                     something,
                                                                     and
                                                                     cannot
                                                                     store
                                                                     a
                                                                     value.
                                                                     Henceforth,
                                                                     they
                                                                     are
                                                                     assigned
                                                                     values
                                                                     using
                                                                     continuous…
                                                                     :name: wire-elements-must-be-continuously-driven-by-something-and-cannot-store-a-value.-henceforth-they-are-assigned-values-using-continuous

                                                            ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/difference-between-reg-and-wire-in-verilog-b7484610c849>`__

                                                            .. container::

                                                               2 min
                                                               read·Mar
                                                               16

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/difference-between-reg-and-wire-in-verilog-b7484610c849>`__

                                                                           Harshdixit

                                                            .. container::

                                                               ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/rtos-programming-in-keil-ide-for-stm32f401re-e25e5416a947>`__

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: RTOS
                                                                     Programming
                                                                     in
                                                                     Keil
                                                                     IDE
                                                                     for
                                                                     STM32F401RE
                                                                     :name: rtos-programming-in-keil-ide-for-stm32f401re

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: Hi ,
                                                                     In
                                                                     previous
                                                                     we
                                                                     had
                                                                     talk
                                                                     about
                                                                     the
                                                                     RTOS
                                                                     and
                                                                     what
                                                                     is
                                                                     RTOS ?
                                                                     and
                                                                     what
                                                                     are
                                                                     its
                                                                     type ?
                                                                     :name: hi-in-previous-we-had-talk-about-the-rtos-and-what-is-rtos-and-what-are-its-type

                                                            ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/rtos-programming-in-keil-ide-for-stm32f401re-e25e5416a947>`__

                                                            .. container::

                                                               4 min
                                                               read·Sep
                                                               6

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/rtos-programming-in-keil-ide-for-stm32f401re-e25e5416a947>`__

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                              .. container::

                                                                                 .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. container::

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                       .. container::

                                          .. container::

                                             .. container::

                                                .. container::

                                                   .. container::

                                                      .. container::

                                                         .. container::

                                                            ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/coding-pulse-width-modulation-from-microcontroller-stm32f103c8tx-519a4568ac7a>`__

                                                            .. container::

                                                               |Coding
                                                               Pulse
                                                               width
                                                               Modulation
                                                               from
                                                               microcontroller
                                                               STM32F103C8Tx|

                                                         .. container::

                                                            .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981>`__

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           |Harshdixit|

                                                                           .. container::

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981>`__

                                                                        .. container::

                                                                           Harshdixit

                                                            .. container::

                                                               ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/coding-pulse-width-modulation-from-microcontroller-stm32f103c8tx-519a4568ac7a>`__

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: Coding
                                                                     Pulse
                                                                     width
                                                                     Modulation
                                                                     from
                                                                     microcontroller
                                                                     STM32F103C8Tx
                                                                     :name: coding-pulse-width-modulation-from-microcontroller-stm32f103c8tx

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  .. rubric:: Read
                                                                     my
                                                                     first
                                                                     article
                                                                     before
                                                                     jumping
                                                                     to
                                                                     this
                                                                     article
                                                                     and
                                                                     also
                                                                     take
                                                                     out
                                                                     your
                                                                     pen
                                                                     and
                                                                     notes
                                                                     with
                                                                     me
                                                                     to
                                                                     calculate
                                                                     frequencies ,
                                                                     prescalar …
                                                                     :name: read-my-first-article-before-jumping-to-this-article-and-also-take-out-your-pen-and-notes-with-me-to-calculate-frequencies-prescalar

                                                            ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@harshdixit1981/coding-pulse-width-modulation-from-microcontroller-stm32f103c8tx-519a4568ac7a>`__

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                           in
                                                                           Embedded
                                                                           C
                                                                           :name: pointers-in-embedded-c

                                                                     .. container::

                                                                        .. rubric:: Pointers
                                                                           play
                                                                           a
                                                                           crucial
                                                                           role
                                                                           in
                                                                           memory
                                                                           management,
                                                                           serving
                                                                           as
                                                                           variables
                                                                           that
                                                                           hold
                                                                           the
                                                                           address
                                                                           of
                                                                           another
                                                                           variable
                                                                           and
                                                                           enabling
                                                                           the…
                                                                           :name: pointers-play-a-crucial-role-in-memory-management-serving-as-variables-that-hold-the-address-of-another-variable-and-enabling-the

                                                                        we
                                                                        work
                                                                        with
                                                                        inheritance,

                                                                        of

                                                                        and

                                                                        summarized
                                                                        as
                                                                        the
                                                                        following:

                                                                        Signal

                                                                        (DSP)

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. rubric:: Digital
                                                                        Signal
                                                                        Processing
                                                                        (DSP)
                                                                        plays
                                                                        a
                                                                        vital
                                                                        role
                                                                        in
                                                                        modern
                                                                        technology.
                                                                        As
                                                                        an
                                                                        essential
                                                                        component
                                                                        of
                                                                        various
                                                                        electronic
                                                                        devices
                                                                        and…

                                                                              Kr

                                                                              Kr

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@dd.identity/tcp-handling-in-linux-cc864f35818b>`__

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. rubric:: TCP
                                                                        handling
                                                                        in
                                                                        Linux
                                                                        :name: tcp-handling-in-linux

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. rubric:: In
                                                                        the
                                                                        last
                                                                        article
                                                                        I
                                                                        explained
                                                                        packet
                                                                        flow
                                                                        in
                                                                        the
                                                                        linux
                                                                        kernel
                                                                        and
                                                                        netfilter
                                                                        hooks.
                                                                        This
                                                                        time
                                                                        I’ll
                                                                        zoom
                                                                        in
                                                                        to
                                                                        the
                                                                        TCP
                                                                        part
                                                                        of
                                                                        the
                                                                        network…
                                                                        :name: in-the-last-article-i-explained-packet-flow-in-the-linux-kernel-and-netfilter-hooks.-this-time-ill-zoom-in-to-the-tcp-part-of-the-network

                                                               ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@dd.identity/tcp-handling-in-linux-cc864f35818b>`__

                                                                  9 min

                                                                  12

                                                                              bansal

                                                               .. container::

                                                                  ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@TheAnshuman/what-is-firmware-and-kernel-4115708ac4f4>`__

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. rubric:: What
                                                                        is
                                                                        Firmware
                                                                        and
                                                                        Kernel ?
                                                                        :name: what-is-firmware-and-kernel

                                                                  .. container::

                                                                     .. rubric:: Previouly
                                                                        we
                                                                        have
                                                                        used
                                                                        Firmware
                                                                        and
                                                                        Kernel
                                                                        both
                                                                        so
                                                                        lets
                                                                        understand
                                                                        indepth
                                                                        difference.
                                                                        :name: previouly-we-have-used-firmware-and-kernel-both-so-lets-understand-indepth-difference.

                                                               ` <https://archive.ph/o/CnMQt/https://medium.com/@TheAnshuman/what-is-firmware-and-kernel-4115708ac4f4>`__

                                                                  16

         +------------------+
         | `50% <#50%>`__   |
         +------------------+
         | `  <#55%>`__     |
         +------------------+
         | `60% <#60%>`__   |
         +------------------+
         | `  <#65%>`__     |
         +------------------+
         | `70% <#70%>`__   |
         +------------------+
         | `  <#75%>`__     |
         +------------------+
         | `80% <#80%>`__   |
         +------------------+
         | `  <#85%>`__     |
         +------------------+
         | `90% <#90%>`__   |
         +------------------+
         | `  <#95%>`__     |
         +------------------+
         | `100% <#100%>`__ |
         +------------------+
